Violation_Type: Failure to meet procedural deadline (PIF submission)
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in declaring the refugee claim abandoned due to lack of diligence
Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA Section 168(1) - Duty to comply with deadlines
Application_Facts: Applicant missed the PIF deadline; cited delays from Legal Aid and unavailability of POE notes
Defendant_Behavior: Failure to submit PIF on time without accepted exceptional circumstances
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error by the Board in finding abandonment due to lack of diligence
Assessment_Factor: Presence or absence of exceptional circumstances for delay
Procedural_Issue: Declaration of abandonment under RPD Rule 58(3)
Evidence_Used: Applicant's explanation regarding Legal Aid and missing POE notes
Evidence_Assessed: Explanation for delay in PIF submission
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of documented evidence supporting exceptional circumstances
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient proof of external factors causing delay
Court_Ruling: Board's decision was reasonable; application for judicial review dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Boardâ€™s abandonment decision
Decision_Rationale: No exceptional circumstances found; lack of diligence established
Cause_Description: Late submission of PIF led to abandonment proceedings
Procedure: Judicial review to assess application of standards and evidence consideration
Harm_Assessment: Loss of refugee claim due to procedural default
Application_Basis: Failure to meet PIF deadline without acceptable justification
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's explanation not deemed sufficient to excuse delay
Residency_Compliance: N/A - issue pertains to claim process, not residency status
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over RPD decisions
Evidence_Handling: Board considered applicant's explanation but found it inadequate
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroborating evidence for claimed delays
